data.title: Margrethe II, Queen of Denmark
data.meta_description: Margrethe II, Queen of Denmark (born Princess Margrethe of Denmark on 16 April 1940) is the current reigning Queen of Denmark. She is the eldest daughter of King Frederik IX of Denmark and Princess Ingrid of Sweden. She is also a member of the extended Swedish Royal Family as the granddaughter...
data.text:
Margrethe II, Queen of Denmark (born Princess Margrethe of Denmark on 16 April 1940) is the current reigning Queen of Denmark. She is the eldest daughter of King Frederik IX of Denmark and Princess Ingrid of Sweden. She is also a member of the extended Swedish Royal Family as the granddaughter of King Gustaf VI Adolf of Sweden.

Life[]

At the time of her birth, only males could inherit the throne of Denmark. As Margrethe had no brothers, it was assumed that her uncle, Knud, Hereditary Prince of Denmark, would succeed her father. The process of changing the constitution started in 1947, not long after Margrethe's father ascended the throne and it became clear that Queen Ingrid would have no more children. The popularity of Frederik and his daughters and the more prominent role of women in Danish life started the complicated process of altering the constitution.

On 27 March 1953, the new Act of Succession was passed and Margrethe became heiress presumptive.

Marriage and Issue[]

After ascending the throne at the age of 32 and still unmarried, many began to speculate about the new queen's marriage prospects and the future of the monarchy. During an official visit to Paris in 1966, the then-Princess Margrethe had met French nobleman Michael, Count of Monpezat. Her father, however, was against the match and forbade them from marrying. Instead, the couple discreetly dated for seven years, until the king passed and Margrethe took the throne.

On 5 October 1973, the Danish court announced Margrethe and Michael's engagement. The couple were married in Copenhagen on 10 June 1974. It was the first marriage of a reigning Danish monarch since King Christian VII married Princess Caroline Matilda of Great Britain in 1796. After nine years of marriage, Margrethe gave birth to their only child, Frederika, in 1985 at the age of forty-five.

On 13 February 1987, Margrethe and Michael were involved in a car accident outside of Copenhagen. Margrethe survived with minor injuries, however Michael was thrown from the vehicle and killed instantly.
